titleStmt.title: Minutes of the TEI Technical Council
titleStmt.meeting: TEI Technical Council online meeting : 10 June 2022

sourceDesc.p: Retagged from a WordPress HTML file

revisionDesc.change: Extracted from Word Press article with id post-31336

list.item: 7am PDT / 10am EDT / 4pm CEST
Started: 15:04Z Ended: 16:32Z
Syd Bauman (SB, joined @ 15:15Z)
Helena Bermúdez Sabel (HBS)
Elisa Beshero-Bondar (EBB)
Elli Bleeker (EB)
Hugh Cayless (HC)
Martina Scholger (MS)
Sabine Seifert (SS)
Peter Stadler (PS, joined @ 15:28Z)
Raff Viglianti (RV)
Janelle Jenstad (JJ)
Magdalena Turska (MT)

F2F meeting in Newcastle
September 11–13 (Sun–Tue).
It seems likely that it will be okay, yes. Would we want to start on Saturday and keep Tuesday off for some workshops? Or start on Sunday? We should canvas everyone since this meeting is not fully attended. ACTION on MS to set up a poll. (Done: ACTION on everyone else to fill it out.)
Invitations
James Cummings
David Maus
Martin Holmes

Joint Board/Council meeting
Monday afternoon followed by dinner

Submissions
Do we want to submit something together / ask to reserve a slot?
There will be some submissions by the Council:
ATOP submission
Gender submission
RV is considering a workshop around new tools he’s been developing for CETEIcean/Gatsby.
Last was 19 Apr
Next release is planned for mid-October.
Possible release techs are SS, PS, & MS. (Making this an all-European effort.)
Moved to Fri 01 July
Next Council meeting is 08 July
Action on SB, HC, MS: Review PR 2299 by 2022-06-24

To deal with automated generation of spec lists on branches and dev (which makes branches become outdated and difficult to merge), HC recommends simply merge (don’t rebase) and resolve differences using GitHub’s diff merge tool: just resolve one of the different spec list files and it’ll be fine. HBS: there may be a way to merge and prioritize dev version if your stuff is entirely different from what people did in dev.
Action on HC and EBB to update the prose by 2022-07-10
Action on HC, SB, or EBB after prose updated: make PR for the branch.

Discussion of the word “chunk” which isn’t easy to translate. Yet it has been with the Guidelines for a long time, and is all over the Guidelines. Original analogy was to soup with “chunks” floating in broth.

Areas that we know need updating include:
STBTC
COPA (which is seriously problematic, particularly the first sentence with its totalizing assumptions about paragraphs)

There should be a longer discussion during the F2F meeting in Newcastle on how to organize, harmonize, and update the documentation. Currently, there is documentation on the Wiki, on the WordPress website, and in the GitHub repository.
EBB reviewed the current status of the p5subset.xml documentation in the Google Doc.https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UhCg76_AgnS5PW0g_EN6zPZE4tTUs0bNeMXFVmZ4VuQ/edit#heading=h.yg4zfkshniwp
Action on EB and SB: consolidate the documentation when they update the p5subset.xml in June.
Documentation on p5subset.xml will become TCW31.

TCW32 needs some review (currently in the TCW repo), to be linked to the public.
We need to clarify the naming scheme:
TEI U: a paper that is intended for the community as a User Guide, e.g. TEI U5 was TEI Lite. Lou Burnard’s ODD-Chaining documents would be TEI Ux.

attributes of attRef
https://github.com/TEIC/TEI/issues/2282
Our explanation in Guidelines isn’t clear enough about what it means to use `@class` without `@name` or vice versa.
Sub-group of assignees (PS, MS, SS, SB) will meet to make a a suggestion.
Action on MS to schedule a meeting

sequence of top level elements within msdesc
https://github.com/TEIC/TEI/issues/2214
Council favors loosening the content model and is thinking about how to implement it. Consider whether any possible sequence of these elements really makes sense, or if we can limit it a little. How loose does the content model need to be? Do we just want to permit these two possible sequences, or ANY possible sequence?
Council make this ticket Green + Yellow: Action on MS to take this to the MS-SIG to discuss
